talkJson.description:
Architects draw detailed blueprints before a brick is laid or a nail is hammered. Programmers and software engineers seldom do. A blueprint for software is called a specification. The need for extremely rigorous specifications before coding complex or critical systems should be obviousâ€”especially for concurrent and distributed systems. This talk explains why some sort of specification should be written for any software.
